So I've never posted my own NWN build...or even tried to build one from the ground up really. I usually get a vague idea of what I want to play, search the ECB vault, find something close to what I was interested in and play that. Recently I've started tweaking builds quite a bit and some of my own ideas started surfacing. This is my first attempt at trying to execute one of those ideas, so I apologize if it is atrocious. I'm hoping some of the more experienced here can help me better mold this build.

I started out with several desires, then just tried to attain them as best as possible. Here are some of those:
High AB
Moderate AC
2-H Weapon
High STR
Moderate CHA for self-buff AC via Divine Shield
High Sneak Attack
Hide in Plain Sight (Stealthing in Plate!? )

Resulting Class Spread Rogue 17/Blackguard 22/Shadowdancer 1

I realize most sneak attacking HiPSers are typically Dex builds and trust me, I quickly found my list to be a tall order. Balancing the initial ability scores while trying to net the required feats for both prestige classes was difficult.

Of course, this turned out to be mostly a dud. I didn't necessarily feel I got the feats I wanted or needed while coming out underpowered in the long run.
At this point I would graciously accept improvements upon this build idea, OR...
I am contemplating altering the build more drastically. In other words, probably dropping the Shadowdancer level and HiPSing/Stealth aspect thereby clearing up feats for things like Improved Knockdown and Expertise while shifting ability scores to more heavily favor STR and CHA. I am not sure what I would do with the space for that third class. Assassin came to mind first, but something like Fighter may prove useful as well.

I appreciate you taking the time to read this and any suggestions you may have to offer.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Hail, Ace of Spades!

I don't mean to be overly critical of your build, but one common mistake we see novice builders making is THEY WANT TOO MUCH! I can't stress that enough!!!!!

The concept is intriguing, but you have LOADS of requirements to fulfill due to SD and BG and ZERO bonus feats to do it pre-epic. That is problem number 1. Problem number 2 is what you really need to understand, and it's quite simple, actually. Every point you put in stat X is one point less you put in stat Y. So, you simply can't have high AB AND moderate CHA. It's impossible, plain and simple. Either you have high AB by taking classes with full BAB progression pre-epic AND putting all stat points and "leftover" feats into Strength OR you put them in Charisma and have a less bad AC. There is no way inbetween. What you can do to make your AC less bad is to take Expertise and Improved Expertise for +10 SITUATIONAL AC, and when that's not enough, walk around with a 1-handed weapon and a shield to act in conjunction with that in raising your AC. Not only that BUT, your classes also require stats. 13 STR for Power Attack, which is OK, 13 DEX for Dodge, which is not OK (makes you end up with 13 CON, which is also not OK).

38 AB for non-self-buffing meleer is low, I'd even risk saying VERY LOW. So, you need to have a think and decide which one is more important to you: AB and damage or AC and saves (and situational damage with Divine Might). If it's AB, go for STR in all enhancements, drop CHA down to about 14 - 16 and be content with gear enhancements to CHA, which will make your DM / DS moderately useful depending on gear available.

So, I'll stop at this, since it's a lot of info at once. What's your priority? What do you want to be good at? As a general rule, min/maxed characters are more powerful than average Joes, so you need to make up your mind here on what you want and go for it.

Take it EZ!

Yes, as I said I noticed quickly that it was a tall order. Stretched too thin to meet too many requirements.

I'm liking my idea more of just dropping the Shadowdancer aspect. This frees up feats and ability scores. I guess I'd more like to see a high DPS hitter (high AB, high damage), using a 2H weapon with high sneak attack potential. Focusing more on maybe improved knockdown and epic fiendish servant to generate sneaks.

That would probably more so require something like Rogue/Fighter/BG or Rogue/Barb/BG...and I'm sure many variants of that are already floating around.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
That would be nice, but 38 AB is still quite low for a meleer. You should aim at something around 43 at the lowest, 45 being the ideal number. If you focus on just Strength, I believe you can get there. I think Fighter makes sense, it gives bonus feats, which makes you proficient in melee combat and you can go for Disarm / improved Disarm since you are a 2-hander. The bonus granted by large weapons is quite nice.

As for spread, I'm thinking Rogue 13 / BG 19 / Ftr 8. A bit less SA damage, but more feats, WS / EWS and 2 Rogue Bonus Feats (which give You Improved Evasion and one more).

Take it EZ!

posts.content:
Taking Mick's build, I'd replace Called Shot and Toughness with Disarm and Improved Disarm. If you're wielding a 2-hander, Disarm is where it works best!

Otherwise looks quite cool. I'd consider dropping 2 DEX for 2 CHA to add +1 to saves at the cost of 1 AC.

Take it EZ!
